report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.08.0]
**INSTITUTION PALLIATIVE CARE HISTORY AND PHYSICAL EXAMINATION
PATIENT NAME: **NAME[AAA, BBB] ACCOUNT #: **ID-NUM **ROOM ATTENDING PHYSICIAN: **NAME[ZZZ M YYY] ADMISSION DATE: **DATE[Jul 20 2006]
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
The patient is an **AGE[in 80s]-year-old woman with hypertension and diabetes mellitus who was found down in her house on **DATE[Jun 23 2006]. She had an intracerebral hemorrhage which was drained. She had a very complicated hospital course with multiple infections over the next month and was, therefore, made comfort measures only, transferred to floor and on hospice on **DATE[Jul 20 2006].
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
1. Hypertension. 2. Hypothyroidism. 3. Diabetes. 4. Spinal stenosis.
SOCIAL HISTORY:
Next of kin is her niece, who I met today. She lives alone. No tobacco, alcohol or IVDA.
MEDICATIONS:
Her medications are as noted in the chart.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
Review of systems and other history is obtainable from her, and she is not talking.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
The patient's eyes are slightly opened. Her tongue is protruded. She has a trach. She has some rhonchi. She does not respond to verbal or tactile stimulation.
HEENT is otherwise, unremarkable.
Mouth: No lesions.
Lungs: Rhonchi. No other abnormalities.
Cardiac: Regular rate and rhythm without murmurs, rubs, gallops.
Abdomen: Soft, nontender.
Skin: Intact.
LABORATORY DATA:
Laboratory data was reviewed.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
The patient is now on hospice, will focus on comfort. I spend 25 minutes talking to the niece about what to expect and what was going to happen next.
___________________________________ **NAME[WWW M. XXX] M.D.
Dictator: **NAME[WWW M XXX]
